alert.note: Alert for Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 12:57PM CDT until July 18 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following county, Scott. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms, with between 1 to 3 inches of rain having fallen over the last 3 hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oneida, Huntsville, Helenwood, Winfield, Robbins, Honey Creek State Park, Elgin, Ketchen and Rugby State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
